body.value:
AGRICULTURAL AND MECHANICAL COLLEGE OF TEXAS,
Department of Mathematics.

LOUIS L. McINNIS, A. M.

COLLEGE STATION December 1885

Col. J.R. Cole occupies the Chair of English Language & Literature, & History in this College from November 1871 to
June 1885-- During the whole of that time his conduct was his College one in the Truest [illegible]

Col. Cole, while here was clothed and acted for his goal & faithfulness in the discharge of every duty-- his manifest
interest in the comfort & welfare of the Students-- his dignified Courtesy in his intercourse with them, his Teaching &
Courteous bearing towards his Colleagues-- & this respect for the opinions of others, as well as his open & honorable
maintenance of his own when he believed them to be right.

It gives the undersigned pleasure to bear this unqualified testimony to Col Cole's integrity as a man--his Courteous
bearing as a Colleague-- his Zeal & faithfulness as a Teacher-- and his high character as a Christian Gentleman--

Louis L. McInnis
Prof. Math.
